subject: Re: subverting Google Maps Street View
body:
Erinn Clark  writes:

> As a resident of San Francisco whose apartment window shows up in
> Google Maps's new "Street View" technology, I'm wondering if there
> is a way to subvert the legality of the pictures by displaying, say,
> copyrighted material in my window. Or some such.

I'm not seeing the relevance this has for debian-legal. Perhaps you
want a general discussion forum?

-- 
 \        "Most people don't realize that large pieces of coral, which |
  `\       have been painted brown and attached to the skull by common |
_o__) wood screws, can make a child look like a deer."  -- Jack Handey |
Ben Finney


-- 
To UNSUBSCRIBE, email to debian-legal-REQUEST@lists.debian.org
with a subject of "unsubscribe". Trouble? Contact listmaster@lists.debian.org
